intro: Oldenlandia rhabdina, commonly known as the slender leaf moonflower, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features opposite, lanceolate leaves and produces small, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshy areas. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
